intro: Neobartsia stricta, commonly known as the rigid bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Neobartsia stricta is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
